definition: to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])

sentences.english: He liked to tell funny stories to make people laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢讲好笑的故事逗人发笑。

sentences.english: Clowns like to make people laugh.
Rabbits have red eyes which make them look cute.
sentences.chinese: 兔子有使他们看起来逗人喜爱的红色眼睛。

sentences.english: The panda is kind of cute .
sentences.chinese: 这只熊猫有点逗人喜爱。
我打赌你当时很逗人喜爱。

sentences.english: My little brother is a cute baby.
sentences.chinese: 我的小兄弟是一个逗人喜爱的婴孩。

sentences.english: He has a delightfully dry sense of humour.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种很逗人的冷幽默。

sentences.english: I do think he is the jolliest actor.
sentences.chinese: 我看他的确是个最逗人的演员。

sentences.english: That little daughter of your cousin’s is really a dear.
sentences.chinese: 你表哥的那个小女儿真是逗人爱。

sentences.english: I am very clever and cute and kind .
sentences.chinese: 我是非常聪明和逗人喜爱和亲切的。

sentences.english: Anyway, dogs can take care of people, they are cuter and more affectionate than cats.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，狗能照顾人，他们比猫逗人喜爱和富感情。

sentences.english: The elephant is kind of cute.
sentences.chinese: 那头大象有点逗人喜爱。

sentences.english: I could eat you up;you're so cute.
sentences.chinese: 你那么逗人爱，我很喜欢你。

sentences.english: He included a large number of funny stories in his speech.
sentences.chinese: 他在演讲词里面加进了大量逗人的故事。

definition: to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
(old) girl trafficked into a brothel to work as prostitute
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
uproarious/hilarious/to split one's sides laughing/lit. to hold one's belly with both hands
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
